speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: I pray you now, good Master Slender’s servingman

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: and friend Simple by your name, which

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: way have you looked for Master Caius, that calls

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: himself doctor of physic?

speaker: SIMPLE
text: Marry, sir, the Petty-ward, the Park-ward,

speaker: SIMPLE
text: every way; Old Windsor way, and every way but

speaker: SIMPLE
text: the town way.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: I most fehemently desire you, you will also

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: look that way.

speaker: SIMPLE
text: I will, sir.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Pless my soul, how full of cholers I am, and

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: trempling of mind! I shall be glad if he have deceived

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: me. How melancholies I am! I will knog his

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: urinals about his knave’s costard when I have good

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: opportunities for the ’ork. Pless my soul!

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
To
               
              shallow
               
              rivers
              ,
               
              to
               
              whose
               
              falls

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
Melodious
               
              birds
               
              sings
               
              madrigals
              .

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
There
               
              will
               
              we
               
              make
               
              our
               
              peds
               
              of
               
              roses

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
And
               
              a
               
              thousand
               
              fragrant
               
              posies
              .

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
To
               
              shallow
              —

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Mercy on me, I have a great dispositions to cry.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
Melodious
               
              birds
               
              sing
               
              madrigals
              —

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
Whenas
               
              I
               
              sat
               
              in
               
              Pabylon
              —

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
And
               
              a
               
              thousand
               
              vagram
               
              posies
              .

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
To
               
              shallow
               
              rivers
              ,
               
              to
               
              whose
               
              falls

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
Melodious
               
              birds
               
              sings
               
              madrigals
              .

speaker: SIMPLE
text: Yonder he is, coming this way, Sir Hugh.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: He’s welcome.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
To
               
              shallow
               
              rivers
              ,
               
              to
               
              whose
               
              falls
              —

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Heaven prosper the right! What weapons is he?

speaker: SIMPLE
text: No weapons, sir. There comes my master,

speaker: SIMPLE
text: Master Shallow, and another gentleman, from

speaker: SIMPLE
text: Frogmore, over the stile, this way.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Pray you, give me my gown—or else keep it

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: in your arms.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: How now, Master Parson? Good morrow,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: good Sir Hugh. Keep a gamester from the dice,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: and a good student from his book, and it is

speaker: SHALLOW
text: wonderful.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ah, sweet Anne Page!

speaker: PAGE
text: God save you, good Sir Hugh!

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: God pless you from His mercy sake, all of

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: you!

speaker: SHALLOW
text: What, the sword and the word? Do you

speaker: SHALLOW
text: study them both, Master Parson?

speaker: PAGE
text: And youthful still—in your doublet and hose

speaker: PAGE
text: this raw rheumatic day?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: There is reasons and causes for it.

speaker: PAGE
text: We are come to you to do a good office, Master

speaker: PAGE
text: Parson.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Fery well. What is it?

speaker: PAGE
text: Yonder is a most reverend gentleman who, belike

speaker: PAGE
text: having received wrong by some person, is at

speaker: PAGE
text: most odds with his own gravity and patience that

speaker: PAGE
text: ever you saw.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: I have lived fourscore years and upward. I

speaker: SHALLOW
text: never heard a man of his place, gravity, and learning

speaker: SHALLOW
text: so wide of his own respect.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: What is he?

speaker: PAGE
text: I think you know him: Master Doctor Caius, the

speaker: PAGE
text: renowned French physician.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Got’s will and His passion of my heart! I had

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: as lief you would tell me of a mess of porridge.

speaker: PAGE
text: Why?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: He has no more knowledge in Hibbocrates

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: and Galen—and he is a knave besides, a cowardly

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: knave as you would desires to be acquainted

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: withal.

speaker: PAGE
text: I warrant you, he’s the man should

speaker: PAGE
text: fight with him.

speaker: SLENDER
text: O, sweet Anne Page!

speaker: SHALLOW
text: It appears so by his weapons. Keep them

speaker: SHALLOW
text: asunder. Here comes Doctor Caius.

speaker: PAGE
text: Nay, good Master Parson, keep in your weapon.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: So do you, good Master Doctor.

speaker: HOST
text: Disarm them, and let them question. Let them

speaker: HOST
text: keep their limbs whole and hack our English.

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: I pray you, let-a me speak

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: a word with your ear. Verefore vill you not

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: meet-a me?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Pray you, use your patience.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
(
                Aloud
                .
                )
               In good time.

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: By gar, you are de coward, de Jack dog,

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: John ape.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Pray you, let us not be

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: laughing-stocks to other men’s humors. I desire

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: you in friendship, and I will one way or other

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
make you amends.
                 
                (
                Aloud
                .
              ) By Jeshu, I will knog

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: your urinal about your knave’s cogscomb.

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: Diable! Jack Rugby, mine Host de Jarteer,

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: have I not stay for him to kill him? Have I not,

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: at de place I did appoint?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: As I am a Christians soul, now look you, this

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: is the place appointed. I’ll be judgment by mine

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Host of the Garter.

speaker: HOST
text: Peace, I say, Gallia and Gaul, French and Welsh,

speaker: HOST
text: soul-curer and body-curer!

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: Ay, dat is very good, excellent.

speaker: HOST
text: Peace, I say! Hear mine Host of the Garter. Am

speaker: HOST
text: I politic? Am I subtle? Am I a Machiavel? Shall I

speaker: HOST
text: lose my doctor? No, he gives me the potions and

speaker: HOST
text: the motions. Shall I lose my parson, my priest, my

speaker: HOST
text: Sir Hugh? No, he gives me the proverbs and the

speaker: HOST
text:
no-verbs.
                 
                (
                To
                 
                Caius
                .
                )
               Give me thy hand, terrestrial;

speaker: HOST
text:
so.
                 
                (
                To
                 
                Sir
                 
                Hugh
                .
                )
               Give me thy hand, celestial;

speaker: HOST
text: so. Boys of art, I have deceived you both. I

speaker: HOST
text: have directed you to wrong places. Your hearts are

speaker: HOST
text: mighty, your skins are whole, and let burnt sack be

speaker: HOST
text:
the issue. 
                (
                To
                 
                Page
                 
                and
                 
                Shallow
                .
                )
               Come, lay their

speaker: HOST
text:
swords to pawn. 
                (
                To
                 
                Caius
                 
                and
                 
                Sir
                 
                Hugh
                .
                )
               Follow

speaker: HOST
text: me, lads of peace, follow, follow, follow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Afore God, a mad Host. Follow, gentlemen,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: follow.

speaker: SLENDER
text: O, sweet Anne Page!

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: Ha, do I perceive dat? Have you make-a

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: de sot of us, ha, ha?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: This is well! He has made us his vloutingstog.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: I desire you that we may be friends, and let

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: us knog our prains together to be revenge on this

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: same scall, scurvy, cogging companion, the Host of

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: the Garter.

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: By gar, with all my heart. He promise

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: to bring me where is Anne Page. By gar, he deceive

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: me too.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Well, I will smite his noddles. Pray you,

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: follow.
